definition: finding it difficult to control their actions (a compulsive shopper/gambler/liar).
example: Compulsive shoppers.

definition: unable to stop doing something which is usually harmful. addict N.
example: It's easy to get addicted to things such as drugs or alcohol.

definition: very serious (crippling debts/disease).
example: They end up with crippling financial debts.

definition: spend more than someone else.
example: Men over 50 outspend women.

definition: be greater or more important than something else.
example: The advantages outweigh the disadvantages.

definition: shopping to cheer yourself up.
example: She needed some retail therapy after a difficult week.

definition: a shop that sells donated goods for charity.
example: I bought this jacket from a charity shop.

definition: argue about the price until a lower price is agreed.
example: She tried to haggle for a better price.

definition: feel excitement from an activity.
example: He gets a rush from extreme sports.

definition: spend time with other people in a friendly way. sociable ADJ.
example: Do you want to make new friends and socialize more effectively?

definition: a person who is giving a meal or a party. hostess N.
example: Paula and Simon are the hosts.

definition: provide something for someone, especially food, drink, or transport.
example: The host is expected to lay on food and drink.

definition: needing a lot of time (a time-consuming process).
example: Organizing a party can be expensive and time-consuming.

definition: a thing that you give or do to help something be successful. contribute v.
example: Everyone made a contribution.

definition: leave everything clean and tidy (after a party/mess).
example: A lot of food means a lot of clearing up.
persian: مرتب کردن، جمع و جور کردن

definition: intended to be used once or twice then thrown away.
example: Think about disposable plates and cutlery.

definition: before something else happens or is done.
example: Don't advertise it on the internet beforehand.

definition: a person who tries to get into a party without an invitation.
example: You don't want gatecrashers.
persian: مهمان ناخوانده (که خود را تحمیل می‌کند)

definition: (of a party or event) start to become interesting and enjoyable.
example: Parties take a while to warm up.

definition: very loud.
example: Music that is not so deafening.

definition: be louder than other sounds, so they can't be heard.
example: Don't have the music so loud that it drowns out the conversation.
persian: صدای چیزی را تحت الشعاع قرار دادن (به دلیل بلند بودن)

definition: make something more exciting.
example: Party games can liven things up.

definition: become very excited or lose control of your feelings.
example: Don't get carried away!
persian: از خود بیخود شدن، هیجان‌زده شدن بیش از حد

definition: go somewhere quickly or for a fairly short time.
example: Shall we pop round and see Glynnis?
persian: سر زدن، سریع رفتن (برای دیدار کوتاه)

definition: want something or want to do something.
example: She may fancy a bit of company.
persian: هوس چیزی کردن، چیزی را خواستن

definition: used to say you expect something will happen.
example: They'll have fun tonight, no doubt.

definition: having drunk too much alcohol. get/be drunk.
example: I'm sure they won't get drunk.

definition: not relaxed or comfortable with other people.
example: Jim's quite awkward when he's in company.
persian: معذب، دست و پا چلفتی، ناجور

definition: a person who is often alone and usually prefers to be alone.
example: He's a bit of a loner.

definition: a friendly informal meeting or party.
example: We're having a get-together tonight.

definition: take part in an activity with other people.
example: Can I join in?

definition: a friendly reception that makes you feel relaxed.
example: You never get a warm welcome at Laura's.

definition: forming a small group and not letting others join in. clique N.
example: Her friends are all a bit cliquey as well.

definition: being with other people, or an enjoyable person (good company).
example: I like company (being with other people).

definition: go with someone.
example: I'll accompany you.

definition: do something to make people feel more relaxed when meeting for the first time.
example: We played a game to break the ice.

definition: organize a party.
example: They decided to throw a party for her birthday.

definition: a party to celebrate moving into a new home.
example: We were invited to their housewarming party.

definition: provide food and drink for a social event.
example: They hired a company to cater the event.
persian: غذا و پذیرایی فراهم کردن/ خدمات پذیرایی
